front.reference:
Modern Physics Letters A
Vol. 30, No. 1 (2015) 1550005 (13 pages)

docTitle.titlePart: Analysis on modified Chaplygin gas as dark energy model

byline.docAuthor:
Ya-Bo Wu * , Cheng-Yuan Zhang, Jian-Bo Lu, Jun-Wang Lu, Xue Zhang,
Qing-Mei Qi and Bi Fan

byline.affiliation: Department of Physics, Liaoning Normal University,

front.note:
Received 26 September 2014
Revised 4 November 2014
Accepted 4 November 2014
Published 2 January 2015
front.div:
In this paper, we will continue to study the modified Chaplygin gas (MCG) based on
Ref. 25. Concretely, we not only discuss both the change rates of the energy densities and
the Hubble parameter H(z) as a function of the model parameters, which is compared
and consistent with the related data in Ref. 27, but also perform the Om diagnostic
in order to geometrically differentiate the MCG model from the Î›CDM, GCG and CG
models. Moreover, we plot the evolutionary trajectories of MCG model with different
interaction terms in Om planes, and find that the coupling intensity b 2 plays an impor-
tant role in the MCG model. Furthermore, we also reconstruct the potential of MCG
scalar field as well as the dynamics of the scalar field according to the evolution of the
MCG dark energy. It is worth stressing that the results given by us can include the ones
without interaction as the special cases.
front.keyword: Keywords: Modified Chaplygin gas; dark energy; Om diagnostic.
